stem: No resources in Google Cloud can be used without being associated with...
options/0/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/1/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/2/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/3/rationale: All resources in Google Cloud are tracked and their consumption is logged against a project. A project relates resources to a billing method.

stem: A budget is set at $500 and an alert is set at 100%. What happens when the full amount is used?
options/0/title: Everything in the associated project will be suspended because there is no more budget to spend.
options/0/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/1/title: You have a 4-hour courtesy period before Google shuts down all resources.
options/1/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/2/title: A notification email is sent to the Billing Administrator.
options/2/rationale: Budgets in Google Cloud are not a way to prevent spending or stop resources. They are a tool for raising awareness about the consumption of resources so that a business can implement its own consumption management processes.
options/3/title: Nothing. There is no point in sending a notification when there is no budget remaining.
options/3/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.

stem: How do quotas protect Google Cloud customers?
options/0/title: By preventing resource use in too many zones in a region.
options/0/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/1/title: By preventing resource use of too many different Google Cloud services.
options/1/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
options/2/title: By preventing resource use by unknown users.
options/2/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/3/title: By preventing uncontrolled consumption of resources.
options/3/rationale: Quotas are established at reasonable defaults for common cloud usage and proof of concept activities. If you are planning to scale up a production cloud solution you may need to request that the quotas be raised. This is a reasonable checkpoint to verify that actions that might result in a large consumption of resources are reviewed.
